actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from OMB; Merit Systems Protection Board; Office of Personnel Management; Office of Special Counsel.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil Service, Post Office, and General Services

official_title: A bill to delineate the relationship of the Office of Special Counsel to the Merit Systems Protection Board.

summary.text: Establishes the Office of Special Counsel as an office within the Merit Systems Protection Board. Sets forth administrative guidelines to delineate the working relationship between the Office and the Board. Requires the budget for the Office to be included in the Board's budget request as a separate line item appropriation. Prohibits the Board from making substantive modifications in the Office's budget. Grants the Office direct access to Congress. Requires the Office to submit to the Board: (1) copies of prepared testimony to be presented to Congress; and (2) for the Board's approval, any legislative changes proposed to Congress. Permits the Office to have its own public relations operation.
